page.title: 03THE PEAK FOREST CANAL.
page.content: Once used for the transportation of coal and raw materials for canalside factories,the Peak Forest canal fell into disuse with the coming of the Railway Age.Thanks to the efforts of conservationists,it has now been largely cleaned and restored, and, together with the{Ashton Canal,}allows the passage of pleasure craft on over 100 mls. of navigable waterways known as the{Cheshire Ring.}Not only does the canal provide facilities for hikers,anglers and boatmen,it is also of interest to students of industrial archeology.Even today,some factories on the canalside depend on water abstracted from it for their boilers and for use in some industrial processes.
